past simple and past participle of
recline
[ I or T ] to lean or lie back with the upper part of your body in a nearly horizontal position: She was reclining elegantly on the sofa. He reclined his head against/on my shoulder.
[ T ] If you recline a chair, you change the position of its back so that it is in a leaning position.
